result.execSummary:
The defendant Evan K Buraczynski was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: To be paid within 30 days or penalty of 8 days Huber for non-payment.

DNA Surcharge waived.
DNA Sample waived.
  Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of completion of Community Service, payment of all costs/fees, proof of enrollment in school and no new criminal law violations.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Evan K Buraczynski

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Attorney Mark E. Kershek in court.   Defendant Evan K Buraczynski did not appear.   Bryan C. Bayer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Appearance waived.  Defendant is still working on the conditions for expunction.  Court takes the matter off the calendar.  Attorney Kershek may request this matter to be heard at a later date.
dated August 21, 2015 from WCS, regarding community service as condition of sentencing (reviewed by Judge Ramirez on 08-24-15)
of Complication for 20 hours Community Service.  Defendant completed 22 hours at St. Joseph Middle School, Waukesha.
Review hearing on September 11, 2015 at 11:15 am.

Defendant Evan K Buraczynski in court with attorney Mark E. Kershek.  Barbara A. Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Kershek advises they are waiting on transcripts to grant expunction.  Review hearing scheduled for September 11, 2015 at 11:15 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Evan K Buraczynski
Current: 7028 Ashwood Ln., Wind Lake, WI 53185 United States  (Effective: 07-30-2015)
Prior: 1629 S Calhoun Rd, New Berlin, WI 53151
Review hearing on August 17, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Evan K Buraczynski in court with attorney Mark E. Kershek.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Konrad Paczuski, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 2.  Court finds defendant guilty.  Count 1 dismissed and read in.

Court orders the following: 
- Fine totaling: $379.00 to be paid within 30 days; alternate 8 days Huber
- 20 hours Community Service
- DNA Surcharge waived
- DNA Sample waived
- Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of completion of community service, payment of all costs/fees, proof of enrollment in school and no new criminal law violations.
  Review hearing scheduled for August 17, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 10, 2015 at 02:15 pm.

Case not called on the record.  Attorney Mark Kershek appeared earlier and stated he has been appointed to this case and requested a plea and sentencing hearing.  A tentative date was chosen.  Defendant was in the courtroom and the Court discussed the date with him.  He had no objections.  Court accepts the date chosen earlier and will not call this case on the record today.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 10, 2015 at 02:15 pm.

Defendant Evan K Buraczynski in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Becky Van Dam, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant has not yet been to the State Public Defender's Office and requests time to go.  Hearing scheduled for May 29, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.

Defendant Evan K Buraczynski in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.
  Hearing scheduled for May 14, 2015 at 10:00 am.
